column5: anybody ever been up there or know about snow lake or wekuska lodge(?). just curious.

I fish this area every year. Don't bother with Wekusko lake as its a lake thats been hit hard with anglers and netting and is struggling to rebound. I know the owner of Wekusko lodge (Tony Brew) your best bet is to fish Tramping lake which he guides on, its a great fishery.There's many more lakes in this area that have great fishing. NMhttp://www.xtremesportfishing.com/forum
Isn't this a defunct mining town now turned to fishing for tourist?
Isn't this a defunct mining town now turned to fishing for tourist?

Fishing was always there for tourism as thats all it has to offer and great fishing it has. Snow lake itself has good walleye fishing stocked trout lakes its my favourite area in Manitoba to fish,Flin Flon is not far either another great area to fish. The mine is in shutdown mode in Snow lake. NM

Fishing was always there for tourism as thats all it has to offer and great fishing it has. Snow lake itself has good walleye fishing stocked trout lakes its my favourite area in Manitoba to fish,Flin Flon is not far either another great area to fish. The mine is in shutdown mode in Snow lake. NM

Have gone there 3 times. Lots of big walleyes and pike. Email me for more info, and/or do search. An interesting place, Tony,the resort owner,is a fine fellow, and also very interesting to talk with. Nothern Manitoban (Dave)knows the area very well.

Fantastic fishing area. New Britannia Mine in town is closed, but HBMS mine just outside of town remains open. I agree with the comment to fish Tramping Lake. Want small eaters? - fish Snow Lake itself and stop by the Diamond Willow for lunch or a pop. Also, if you can, while in the area, fish Reed Lake and move on over to Athapapusko (by Flin Flon 1-1/2 hours away) for great deep water lake trout action.
